episode_title: 615-616 - The One That Could Have Been
note: {Transcriber’s Note: This is an hour-long special episode. Which means that the first part of this episode is episode 615. The second part of this episode is episode 616. Since episodes 615 and 616 are combined into one file, that’s why there is no episode 616 in the season 6 table of contents and the numbers jump from episode 615 to 617.}

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, you guys! Guess what? Barry and Mindy are getting a divorce!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What is the matter with you?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Barry and Mindy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh sorry, I hear divorce I immediately go to Ross. (To Rachel) Who-who’s Barry and Mindy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Barry was the guy that I was almost married and Mindy was my best friend.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh-oh, wasn’t he cheating on you with her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but that just means that he was falling asleep on top of her instead of me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why did they get divorced?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, apparently she caught him cheating on her with someone else. Isn’t that sad? (Giggles.) God, could you imagine if I actually married him?! I mean how different would my life be?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know what you mean, I’ve always wondered how different my life would be if-if I’d never gotten divorced.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which time?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The first time! No seriously, imagine if Carol hadn’t realized she was a lesbian.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t. I keep seeing it the good way.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’d bet I’d still be doing my kara-tay. (That’s karate, he’s just saying it that way.) Towards the end of our marriage I was doing a lot of kara-tay as a way of releasing the tension from y’know, not doing anything else physical.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe the problem was you were pronouncing it kara-tay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And what if I was still fat? (To Chandler) Well, you wouldn’t be dating me, that’s for sure.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure I would!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh yeah! Come on! Yeah right!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What, you guys really think that I’m that shallow?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I just think Monica was that fat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, imagine if I never got fired off Days Of Our Lives ! (Closes his eyes to do so.) Oh-hey, there’s Carol again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What if I had had the guts to quit my job? I’d probably be writing for the New Yorker , getting paid to be funny. But my job’s fun too! I mean tomorrow, I-I don’t have to wear a tie.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What if I had taken that job at Merrill Lynch ?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Merrill Lynch ?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I had a massage client who worked there and-and he said I had a knack for stocks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well why didn’t you take the job?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because at that time you see, I thought everything that rhymed was true. So I thought y’know that if I’d work with stocks, I’d have to live in a box, and only eat lox, and have a pet fox.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, do you guys think that if all those things happened, we’d still hang out?

content.description: A newsstand, Ross is buying a magazine and gets in line behind a woman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God! Rachel Green?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Rob Tillman!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no. It’s-it’s me, Ross!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Ross Tillman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no-no, Ross Geller.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, of course Monica’s brother!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! How are you?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good-good, I’m-I’m married. (Shows her his ring.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! Me too!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is-isn’t it the best?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s the best! (They both exhale contemplating the joys of marriage.) So, umm how’s Monica?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh really, really great! Yeah! A-actually she’s right down the street, umm, do-do you know what? You should stop bye and say hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, I would love too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? Oh-oh, she’d be so excited!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! Okay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on! (They start to leave.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wait, don’t you have to pay for your, (looks at his magazine) Busty Ladies?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s okay. Some-some kid asked me to pick it up for him, but I don’t…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah? Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.
content.parenthetical: putting the magazine back and holding the money for it

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But! Don’t you have to give him his money back?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh. (Steps to a random kid nearby and hands him his money.) Hey, here you go buddy. Sorry, no porn for you. (To Rachel) Okay, let’s go see Monica!

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Fat Monica, and her boyfriend are sitting on the couch. Monica’s boyfriend is getting up to get something. For future reference, for the rest of this episode Monica’s fat, I won’t be calling her Fat Monica throughout.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So Monica, still going out with Dr. Boring huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s not boring! He’s just-he’s just low key.

content.speaker: Monica’s Boyfriend
content.text: Here we go, one Hazelnut Latte. (Hands it to Monica and sits down.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Monica’s Boyfriend
content.text: Yeah. Y’know, the hazelnut actually not a nut, it’s a seed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow!!

content.speaker: Monica’s Boyfriend
content.text: Can anyone else name a well known seed that’s been masquerading as a nut?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh dear God, let me think. (Starts to sarcastically think about it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no! What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh I just got another rejection letter. They said my writing was funny, just not “ Archie Comic funny.”

content.speaker: Monica’s Boyfriend
content.text: Y’know what honey? I got to get back to the hospital.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica’s Boyfriend
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Monica’s Boyfriend
content.text: Bye-bye. (Gets up to leave.) Oh uh, by the way, the answer is, the Brazil nut. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Was his question what’s more boring than him?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey man, look sorry about that Archie thing. Do uh, do you need me to give you some money?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, I may have no money, but I still have my pride.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ehh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe Joey doesn’t have to give you the money, TV stars have assistants right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s an idea! (To Chandler) Hey, if I hired an assistant, would-would you take money from her?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No Joey! Chandler could be your assistant! See, he could answer all of your fan mail and stuff!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s great! That would be great! Let’s do that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I could use the money; it could give me time to write.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh right great! Welcome aboard!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Now hey, I need to use the bathroom. Since I don’t need any assistance in there, take a break!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right!
(As Joey goes to the bathroom, Corporate Phoebe enters. She’s wearing a business suit and carrying a briefcase.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Phoebe! Guess what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey just hired Chandler to be his assistant!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh that’s so sweet! (Her cell phone rings.) Oh! Hang on! (Quickly grabs a cigarette and starts to light it as her phone rings.) Hang onnnnnn!!! (Gets the cigarette lighted and answers the phone.) (On phone.) Go!! No! No-no! I said sell when it hits 50! 5-0, it’s a number! It comes after 4-9!! No, it’s okay. It’s okay, you’re allowed one mistake. Just kidding, you are of course fired.
(She hangs up as Ross and Rachel enter.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Mon!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mon, look who I ran into! (Gestures towards Rachel.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Rachel!! (Rachel is stunned to see that her long lost friend is still fat.) (Monica goes over and gives Rachel a big bear hug, which is quite easy for her.) You look terrific!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, so do you! Did you lose weight? (She’s not quite sure of that one.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You are so sweet to notice! Yes, I lost three and a half pounds!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And, and uh, you-you remember my friend Chandler. (Points to him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And that’s Phoebe over there! (Points to her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, sit down! Sit down! How long as it been since we’ve seen each other?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 1987, the day after Christmas, at Sean McMahon’s party. I played you one of my songs, y’know Interplanetary Courtship Ritual.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah. Right. So now, are—do you, do you still do music?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sometimes, you should come over (Joey returns from the bathroom) sometime! I’ll play you one of my other…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Joey Tribbiani from Days of Our Lives , just walked in here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, he’s a friend of ours.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You are friends with Dr. Drake Remoray?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well it’s kinda hard to be friends with Drake because of his busy schedule and the fact that he’s not real.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-hey, or I could bring my keyboard over here sometime!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He’s coming over! He’s coming over!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, here-here!! (Hands her the plate.)
content.parenthetical: holding a plate of what looks like Rice Crispies Treats

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohhh! (Takes the plate.) No! This is my friend Rachel, we went to High School together.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!
content.parenthetical: giggles and can’t look at him

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! I love you on that show! I watch you everyday! I mean, when you took out your own kidney to save your ex-wife even though she tired to kill you…
content.parenthetical: still not quite able to look at him

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, it’s always nice to meet the fans.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s not crazy is she?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So uh, how you doin’?

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe are there. Phoebe’s cell phone rings and she goes through her little routine of lighting a cigarette before answering the phone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hang on! Hang on! Hang on! (Answering the phone.) Go!! Who’s this? (Listens) Oh okay, you’re gonna like working for me. What’s your name? (Listens) What kind of name is Brendy? I… Whatever… Stop talking! All right, from now on your name is Joan. You can pick your own last name.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey there you are!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-oh, it’s my boss!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, here’s a list of things for you to do today. Man, this going to be so great! Thank you so much! All right, I got to go to work I’m delivering twins today, but only one of them is mine! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Drop off my dry cleaning. Pick up my vitamins. Teach me how to spell vitamins. Wear in my new jeans.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You realize what you are don’t you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re his bitch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no!! No!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh wait! You didn’t just sit on my Kit-Kats did you?!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! There-there was a little, a little diff in the market and I lost 13 million dollars.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But the Kit-Kats are all right?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What am I gonna do?! What am I gonna do?! I can’t call my office they’ll kill me! I can’t call my clients they’ll kill themselves! Great, now my chest hearts.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My chest hurts! Oh, and now I-I can’t breathe.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe, are you having a heart attack?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, if I were, would-would I have shooting pains up and down my left arm?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then yes that is what I’m having. (Takes another puff of the cigarette.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.description: A hospital, Phoebe is recovering from her heart attack as Ross, Monica, and Chandler are there to comfort and support her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on Pheebs, it’s not that bad! Y’know most people would be excited if they didn’t have to work for a couple of weeks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Most people don’t like their jobs, I love my job! I have not been working for three hours and I’m already going crazy. I miss Joan.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, having a heart attack is nature’s way of telling you to slow it down.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I always thought having a heart attack was nature’s way of telling you to die! (Phoebe glares at him.) But you’re not gonna die. I mean, you are going to die, but you’re not gonna die today. I wish I was dead.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let’s take a walk. (They start to leave.) Y’know maybe you should consider writing for Talking Out of Your Ass magazine! (They exit.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So what’s going on with you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well umm, I’ve been doing a lot more of my kara-tay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Still going through that dry spell with Carol?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How long has it been since you had sex?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, last weekend…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’s not so bad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …will be two months…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …since I stopped trying.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe you need to spice things up a little.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What-what do you mean?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know. You could tie her up, she could tie you up; you could eat stuff off each other…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, dirty talk, m�nage � trois, toys…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Roll playing… You could be the warden; she could be the prisoner. You could be the pirate; she could be the wench!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I think I got it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Or too, you could be two stockbrokers and you’re-you’re-you’re rolling around naked on the trading floor and everybody’s watching! (Ross looks at her.) It never happened.

content.description: A hospital hallway, Chandler is sitting on a gurney with his hands spread out behind his back. Then Monica comes and plops down on the gurney and one of his hands. Chandler immediately recoils in extreme pain.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sorry. So how’s it going with Joey?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh just great. He beeps me now with codes. One is, “Bring me food.” Two is, “I’m with a girl, bring us food.” Three is, “I’m lost and I can’t find food.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Is uh, is she gonna be all right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! She’s right in there! (Points to Phoebe’s room.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh great. (Starts to go in.) (To Chandler) Hey! Go take off those pants, they look ready!

content.description: Silvercup Studios, Joey is showing Rachel around the set.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, and over there is Brady’s Pub where I like to unwind after a long day of surgeoning.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! This is so amazing! What else? What else?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, that is a large piece of television equipment. (Points at a large piece of television equipment as an old man walks by.) And uh that is an old man! Hey old man!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All righty, what do you say we head back to my place?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Umm, y’know, I-I would really love to, but I-I shouldn’t.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why? (In Drake’s voice.) Why can’t the world stop turning, just for a moment? Just for us?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Isn’t that a line from the show?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, yeah but uh, (In Drake’s voice) I may have said those things before but, I never truly meant them. Until now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s a line from the show too!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, you watch too much TV.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here you go Joe, here’s the freshly squeezed orange juice you asked for. (Hands it to him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks! (Looks at it.) Yeah, there’s pulp in that. (Hands it back.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I thought we talked about this. I don’t like pulp. No pulp. Pulp isn’t juice. All juice, okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry, I guess I just like the pulp.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God, I’m sorry, I’m being so rude. (Turns to Rachel.) Rachel, would like a soda or something? Because Chandler would run right out and get it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah sure, iced tea would be great.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Iced tea.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, anything for you sir?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did I not just tell him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, you did.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay look, Chandler, if this (Motions back and forth indicating the arrangement.) you have got to listen! (Tugs on his ear.) (Chandler glares at him.) You’re gonna throw that juice at me, aren’t ya?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s not all juice! (Rachel quickly gets out of the way.)

content.description: Ross and Carol’s, Ross is trying to talk to Carol about what Phoebe told him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So honey, this morning was fun, huh? Me hopping in on you in the shower there.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Yeah! And maybe someday we could get a place with two bathrooms.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look Carol umm, I was, I was thinking maybe uh, maybe we can spice things up a little.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Carol our sex life is—it’s just not working…

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Dad !! (Runs and hugs him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey there little fella! Hey, uh-hey, why don’t we get some shoes on ya, huh? Hey, why don’t you show dad how you can put your shoes on, in your room! Yay!!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Yay! (Runs off.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yay! (To Carol) Seriously, our sex life… I was thinking, maybe I don’t know, we could try some-some new things. Y’know? For fun?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Like what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I don’t know umm, (Pause) what if we were too tie each other up? (Carol’s shocked and obviously doesn’t like that idea.) Umm, some people eat stuff off one another. (Carol doesn’t like that idea either.) Nah! Umm, y’know we-we could try dirty talk? (Carol still says no.) Umm, we could, we could have a threesome.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I love that idea!

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, Monica is eating breakfast as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who sold a story to Archie Comics?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! That’s great! Oh wow! (Hugs him.) You’re a published writer! I wish I had a present for you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aww.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute! (Quickly checks her pockets and pulls out…) My last Kit-Kat bar!
(Chandler tries to take it, but Monica won’t let go. He tugs harder, and she still doesn’t budge.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You wanna share it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Hey Chandler look, I know you’re mad, but I just want to say I’m sorry. I-I was a total jerk. Completely o-over the line. Uh, I just I hate pulp! Y’know? I mean, y’know how Monica feels about low fat mayonnaise?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s not mayonnaise!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, o-o-o-o-okay anyway, I just wanted to say I’m sorry. Here. (Hands him a cup.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fresh squeezed orange juice, with pulp! Just the way you like it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aww, thanks man. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Joey, Chandler sold a story to Archie Comics!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! That’s great! Congratulations! What’s the story?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh you wouldn’t uh, care. It’s just a stupid comic book story.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you kidding me?! I love Archie! And the whole gang!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well uh, Archie needs money to fix his jalopy (Joey laughs), uh but he doesn’t want Reggie to just give him the money. So Reggie hires him as his assist—as his butler. And then makes him do all these crazy things like bring him milkshakes that can’t have lumps in them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait a minute. That sounds a little familiar! Did they already do that one? ‘Cause I think I read it!

content.description: Central Perk, Monica is there as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Mon, listen I have to ask! Okay, Joey Tribbiani invited me back to his apartment, now does he do this with a lot of girls?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, a lot. A lot, a lot!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! And I’m one of them!! Wow! Oh, I just cannot believe this! I mean, Joey Tribbiani!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, y’know it’s none of my business, but aren’t you married?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Oh I just wish we could not be married for a little bit! Y’know I just wish we could be like on a break!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you’re not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s so easy for you I mean, you’re not married, you get to have sex with who ever you want!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah I can! (Laughs) And don’t think I don’t, because I do! I mean all the time, you betcha! (Laughs.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica. You’ve, you’ve done it right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course I have! What do you think, I’m some 30 year old virgin?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! You’re a 30 year old virgin!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Say it louder, I don’t think the guy all the way in the back heard you!

content.speaker: Guy All the Way in the Back
content.text: Yeah, I heard it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s not like, I haven’t any opportunities. I mean, y’know, I’m just waiting for the perfect guy. I’m seeing this guy Roger, all right? He’s not perfect, but umm, I think maybe I should just get it over with. Y’know, give him my flower.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!! Do it!! Honey, you’ve waited long enough!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? You are right?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!! I mean sex does not have to be a big deal! There shouldn’t be all this rules and restrictions! Y’know, people should be able to sleep with who ever they want, whenever…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel! I’m never gonna think it’s okay for you to cheat on your husband!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh what do you know? Virgin!

content.description: The hospital, Ross and Monica are in Phoebe’s room. Phoebe is in the bathroom and Monica notices smoke coming out from underneath the door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, why is smoke coming out of the bathroom?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, the doctor said that could be one of the side effects.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! Put that cigarette out!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! It’s not a cigarette! The smoke is coming out of me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Put it out!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! Okay! (Puts it out and comes out of the bathroom.) I’m so glad you’re here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on. (Helps her into bed as her phone rings.) I got it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, give it to me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I got it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Give it!
(He does a kara-tay move to silence her, then answers the phone.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello? (Listens.) No she can’t come to the phone right now. (Listens.) Oh, right no problem. Okay, bye-bye. (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Was it my work? Were they mad? Was it Jack? Did he yell?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: J-j-just relax, nobody yelled. Jack just was calling to make sure that you were getting better.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, she’s fired.

content.description: [Scene: Rachel and Barry’s bedroom, Rachel is watching Days of Our Lives. Of course it’s a Dr. Drake Remoray scene. It’s set in a hospital room, and Dr. Wesley and a nurse are talking about a female patient with a bandage around her head.]

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: You’ve done all you can Dr. Wesley. You have got to let her go.

content.speaker: Dr. Wesley
content.text: Good-bye and God speed, Hope Brady.
(He goes to turn off a machine. Suddenly, Dr. Drake Remoray appears at the door with two cops!)

content.speaker: Dr. Drake Remoray
content.text: Not so fast Wesley! (Rachel does a silent clap.)

content.speaker: Dr. Wesley
content.text: Remoray!
content.parenthetical: with evil dripping off his tongue

content.speaker: Dr. Drake Remoray
content.text: That’s right Wesley! I just stopped by to say that, you’re not a real doctor! And that woman’s brain, is fine!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Thank God!
[Cut back to the TV, the cops are leading Dr. Wesley out, and as they pass Remoray and Wesley exchange evil glances.]

content.speaker: Dr. Drake Remoray
content.text: Hope! Hope!

content.speaker: Hope
content.text: Drake!

content.speaker: Dr. Drake Remoray
content.text: You’re not dying Hope, you’re gonna live a long, healthy life. With me.

content.speaker: Hope
content.text: Oh Drake.
[Drake and Hope kiss.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! (She picks up the phone, Joey’s phone number, and starts to dial.) Here we go! Okay! (On phone.) Hi, Joey! It’s Rachel! Umm, I am free tomorrow night. Yeah, sure, sure I can bring some sandwiches.
{Transcriber’s Note: This is where Part II begins, which means this is now episode 616.}

content.description: Ross and Carol’s, Carol is working on something at the table and Ross is reading a newspaper on the couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So honey this uh, this threesome thing umm, I mean how-how are you gonna start to find…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ooh, actually I’ve been making a list of all the women I know who might be into doing this!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. (He takes the notepad she was using and looks at it.) Wow! (Flips to another page.) Huh. (Flips another page.) Boy! (Flips another page.) Well, someone’s been doing their homework. (Flips two more pages.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Yeah. Ooh, and I know Gail Rosten is in there twice, but she is so…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I know. (Laughs) Y’know, just-just talking about it is getting me kinda…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh, me too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? Well, I-I think Ben’s asleep.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh umm, y’know I think it would be better if we just save it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Right. Save it. I can do that. (Gets up and does a little kara-tay.)

content.description: The hospital, Chandler and Monica are there with Phoebe as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, how’s it going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’ve got to get out of this bed, I’m going crazy here. Crazy!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here you go sweetie.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What the hell is this, herbal tea? I hate herbal tea!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But, I put some honey in it.
(Phoebe mocks what Monica just said. Ross pulls Chandler aside.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She doesn’t know she was fired yet, does she?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, the doctors say it may kill her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you two girls whispering about over there?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But I think we should tell her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Pheebs, maybe this whole heart attack thing is a sign, that-that you should start think about getting a different job.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, what is this? A stupid contest? Because we got a winner here! (Points at Ross.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen Phoebe, he’s right. People are not supposed to have heart attacks at 31.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know! But if I didn’t work there, what else would I do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you used to like playing the guitar.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah that was lucrative! Smart like your brother!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, what about y’know the massage thing? That never gave you a heart attack.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm, pulling in a salary in the high six figures or rubbing gross naked people for chump change—ooh, what do I do?! What will I do?!

content.description: Joey’s apartment, (The one he had when he was Dr. Drake Remoray, because he still is.) Rachel is there and admiring the big ceramic fake dog.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, I mean it’s just so realistic!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know. (Joey is sitting in this tall chair that is made up of balls on polls. You’ll have to see it to know what I mean.) Yeah, his name is Pat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pat the dog. Oh! Oh! I get it!! (Laughs and finishes her drink.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you uh, do you—ready for a refill?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I probably shouldn’t—so I will! (Joey starts making her refill and Rachel notices that rain thing Joey has.) Oh! Wow! It’s like it’s raining!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pretty cool, huh? But if you’re thinking you can put a fish in there and it wouldn’t get sucked up into the mechanism, well you’d be wrong.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, can I use your bathroom?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s uh, right through there. (Points.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Starts to go.) God y’know, if someone told me a week ago that I would be peeing in Joey Tribbiani’s apartment…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, life’s pretty great isn’t it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, it sure is!

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, Monica is pouring wine for her boyfriend, Dr. Roger.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I hope you’re hungry, we’re starting with oysters. And y’know what they say about oysters, don’t you?

content.speaker: Dr. Roger
content.text: They have parasites?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Umm well, some people say that Oysters are an aphrodisiac.

content.speaker: Dr. Roger
content.text: What people?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: People! People say it! Come here! (She grabs him and kisses him.)

content.speaker: Dr. Roger
content.text: So oysters, huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And then we’re gonna have a little Middle Eastern cous-cous. Something we can eat, with our hands.

content.speaker: Dr. Roger
content.text: Y’know, it’s funny, but when we were studying communicable diseases…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no-no, no! It’s sensual!

content.speaker: Dr. Roger
content.text: Ohh! Didn’t know! Okay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! (They kiss again and his beeper goes off.) Ohhh no!

content.speaker: Dr. Roger
content.text: I’m sorry sweetie, it’s the hospital. The food looks great, maybe save me some?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t promise anything. (She starts to dig in.)

content.description: Ross and Carol’s, Ross and Carol are waiting anxiously for their new partner to arrive.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re really gonna do this, huh?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Looks like it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, if, if this is too weird for you, we can still back out at… (A knock on the door interrupts him.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I got it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Susan! Hi! (Who’d you think it was gonna be?)

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Hey! (They hug.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Thank you so much for coming.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, I wouldn’t miss it for the world.
(They start moving towards the bedroom, never taking their eyes off each other. They move past Ross and stop.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m-I’m Ross by the way.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Hello Ross. (Takes off her coat and hands it to him.) I love what you’ve done with this space.
content.parenthetical: not taking her eyes off Carol

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Thank you so much.
(They disappear into the bedroom leaving Ross standing in the living room holding Susan’s coat.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How hot is this?!

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, Chandler and Monica are eating Monica’s dinner.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry you’re here with me instead of Roger.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, me too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I could make it seem like he’s here. (Imitates him.) “Here’s some little known facts about cous-cous. They didn’t add the second cous until 1979.” (Mumbles something further.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Stop it!! That’s not funny!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, okay? It just—tonight was supposed to be y’know, it was supposed to be a big deal.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What was tonight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You don’t want to know what tonight was.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Pause.) What was tonight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, tonight was—was going to be my first time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: With Roger? (Monica shyly looks away.) Not just with Roger?! (Monica shrugs.) Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right relax Mr. I’ve Had Sex Four Times!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Four different women! I’ve had sex way more times!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How many?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was just waiting for the perfect guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well good, good for you. You really think that Roger is the perfect guy?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. He’s not a horrible guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey that’s what I tell girls about me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, I’m gonna die a virgin!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No you are not! You are sweet and wonderful and this is gonna happen for you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh really? When? Do you wanna do it with me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (They both realize what he just said.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was kidding.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So was I.

content.description: Joey’s apartment, Rachel is now three sheets to the wind and Joey is watching her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, you’re such an amazing actor! (He smiles.) How do you know where Dr. Drake Remoray leaves off and Joey Tribbiani begins?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, with Dr. Drake they always tell me what to say. And with Joey, I pretty much have to make it up on my own.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Tell me something Joey—(She falls off the couch)—Whoa! I just fell right off the couch there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah you did.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (She climbs back onto the couch.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here you go. Let me ask you a question.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When was the last time someone told you just how beautiful you are?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! I can’t, I can’t feel my hands.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come, come here.
(He takes her hands in his and kisses each one, then kisses her on the lips. When the break the kiss, Rachel starts to get nauseous and throw up. Joey backs away in horror.)

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, continued from earlier. Monica and Chandler are still discussing the previous question.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We can’t do this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! (They both laugh.) Oyster?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! (Takes it.) If-if-if we did do this there would be a lot of pressure on me, y’know? Because you’ve been waiting a very long time and I wouldn’t want to disappoint you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah but see I have nothing to compare it too. So even if you’re horrible, how would I know?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I do like that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s harder for me! I have those four other women to compete with!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, if it helps there were only three. So it would just be for tonight, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Absolutely! It would just be one friend (Points at Chandler) helping out another friend. (Points at herself.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stop it! We’re doing this! Let’s do it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Noo!! Okay!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (They both get up.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, do you have any uhh, moves?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have some moves.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I have no moves. (He moves in to kiss her and she laughs and backs away.) Okay, whatcha doin’ there?! (Giggles.) Oh y’know what? I’m sorry, this is just too weird.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, let’s just forget it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What if I turn out the lights? (Runs to shut them off.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!
(She turns out the lights and in the darkened room Chandler starts to moan.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s the couch.

content.description: Monica’s bedroom, she has just lost her flower to Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! I’ll tell you something, we are gonna do that again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, okay! (He rolls over to do that again.)

content.description: Joey’s apartment, the next morning, Rachel is passed out on the couch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Morning!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh right.
content.parenthetical: wakes up suddenly and realizes where she is

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God. Oh I can’t believe Joey Tribbiani heard me throw up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well he actually saw you a little bit too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo! Oh God we did—we didn’t, we didn’t uhh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No! No, not after seeing that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God I’m just a horrible person.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wh-why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because I’m married. That’s right, I am a married woman! And I came to a TV star’s apartment to have an affair! Uck!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s ridiculous! I’m not a “Star,” just a regular famous actor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah and I’m a horrible, horrible person.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rachel, would you stop saying that?! Hey-hey look, remember on the show when-when Caprice was dying and she gave me…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The ring from the cave, yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Uh okay, well uh… (He gets up, opens a drawer, and pulls out the ring.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, they let you keep that stuff?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure! As long as they don’t find out you can keep whatever you want! And I want you to have it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No-no-no…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Yes!! And every time you look at it, I want you to remember that you are a good person. Okay, you’ve had the chance to cheat, and with me, but you didn’t. And that’s what this ring stands for.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I thought that ring stood for Caprice’s undying love for her brother.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, do you want the ring or not?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.description: Phoebe’s hospital room, Joey and Ross enter as Phoebe comes out of the bathroom wearing her robe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look at you! You’re up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I thought I’d try to take a walk. Would you pour me some water? I’ll be back soon.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa! You’re not gonna use the pay phone to call work, are ya?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. I’ve learned my lesson.
(She goes out into the hall and when she’s there and the door is closed; she rips off her robe to reveal her work clothes.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Let’s go! Come on! Move it! (Grabs her coat.) Come on! (To an old man who’s holding her shoes and briefcase.) Shoes! Briefcase! (Takes them both.) Thanks Lou, good luck with the gall bladder. (She leaves.)
[Cut back to her room, Joey and Ross are sitting there waiting for her.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Joe did… Did you ever have a threesome?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well uh, look Ross I uh, I think Carol’s great and I’m sure you’re a very attractive man, but I…
content.parenthetical: not quite sure of how to answer that

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! The reason I’m asking is that… I sorta had one last night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! So, was it amazing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was, it was okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just okay—Did you do it right?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, it’s just did, did you ever go to a party and think, “Would really anyone miss me if I weren’t here?”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh. But still Ross, you’re worst day with two women, pretty much better than any other day! Y’know what I mean?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh, absolutely!
(They both laugh.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s just, my part seemed to be over pretty quickly and then, and then there was a lot of waiting around.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But you got to be with both of them, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not-not really. Th-th-there was just Carol.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not the other one?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, she kept kicking me away!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you don’t want that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well hey, at least you got to see a lot of stuff, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh I a lot of stuff!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got a little bored?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A little. Yeah. I made a snack.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah? What did ya have?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just a sandwich. Turkey, a little mustard…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sounds good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It really was!

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, Monica is making a sandwich as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let me tell you about this chick I scored with last night! Oh no wait a minute that was you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, check me out, I’m a slut!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you uh, want to do something tonight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh I can’t. Dr. Roger is coming over again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh. Oh right! Right! Because you’re still seeing him and uh, he’s a good guy. I mean, I remember a time when… (He fakes falling asleep.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! Totally! Totally, and you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great! It’s so amazing! I mean, last time Dr. Roger came over, I was so nervous, but then after being with you I’m all like, “Can the doctor see me now?”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I bet he can.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, I don’t have an appointment, but I sure could use a physical. (He laughs halfheartedly) Are you sure you’re okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah! Yeah! Don’t worry about me, I’ll be fine! (Does a kara-tay move.)

content.description: Rachel and Barry’s bedroom, Rachel is returning from her disastrous attempt at an affair to find that Barry was much, much more successful with his.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! My God! Barry!!

content.speaker: Barry
content.text: You-you-you said you were gonna be away all weekend!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh that’s right! I’m sorry! I-I am early! Finish! Please!!

content.description: Phoebe’s office, she is arriving without the knowledge that she’s been fired.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Surprise! Look who’s back!

content.speaker: Arthur
content.text: Hey Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Arthur
content.text: Call security. (To Phoebe) Pheebs, didn’t you get fired?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh, I don’t think so!

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Jack!! Hey!

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All better! Back to work! Except this clown from research told me I was fired. He should do his research, huh?

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: Well, you were fired.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nu-uh!

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: I told that guy who answered your phone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay I didn’t get that message. So this doesn’t count—Anyway, I’ll be in my office.

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: Uh, Phoebe you-you don’t have an office.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s all right, I’ll work here. This is goo, next to this plant. (She picks a place in the lobby next to a plant.)

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: Phoebe, listen…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re in my office! Look, I have made a lot of cash for this company! Okay? I am talking big bucks! Pesos! Yen! Rubles! You make one little mistake…

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: You lost 13 million dollars.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, so this is all about money! Y’know it’s bad enough that—Ow! Oh, you have got to be kidding!

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: Are you all right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m having another heart attack!

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m having another heart attack!! Call 9-1-1!!

content.speaker: Jack
content.text: Take it easy. (Sits her down.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Dumbass!
content.parenthetical: to Arthur, he’s the guy calling 9-1-1

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hey Pheebs! How’s it going?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, they fired me and I’m having heart attack.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Wow! Well, welcome back!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is there as Rachel storms in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is Joey Tribbiani here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, if you see him, will you please tell him that I’m looking for him and that this I am not gonna throw up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That-that’s always good news. Are you okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Me? I’m great! I’m fine! I’m sooo good!! But, you know who’s not great?! Men! You’re a man right Ross?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sit down!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (He does so.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let me uh, let me ask you something, do wedding vows mean squat to you people?! And why is it that the second we tell you we’re going out of town, bamn there you are in bed with the neighbor’s dog walker?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No seriously! Seriously! What has happened to the sanctity of marriage?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Didn’t you spend last night at Joey’s?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aw what are you?! A detective?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look I-I don’t know what’s going on with you and your husband and what is hopefully an adult dog walker, look can I just say not all men are like that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (Doesn’t believe it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! There are some men who will do whatever it takes to make their marriage work! Okay? There are some men who will stand by and-and watch as their wives engage in-in what only can be described as a two some with some-some woman she barely knows from the gym!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who are these men?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Men. I guy I know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you might want to tell him it sounds like his wife is (whispers) gay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She is not… (Realizes) She’s gay. Oh my God. She is so gay! I can’t believe this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good day for married people huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry your husband cheated on you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry your wife is gay. I guess women aren’t that great either.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Try telling my wife that.

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, Monica is blowing out a candle as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay to come in?
content.parenthetical: sticking his head in the door

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, come on, eat, whatever you want. Dr. Roger got beeped again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah I know, guess who beeped him?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m the ruptured spleen. (Laughs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why would you do that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because you shouldn’t be with him. (Pause.) You should be with me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! When you were talking about Roger, that was killing me! Look, things like last night they don’t just happen. Y’know? Or at least not to me. Or with the other two women, in the morning y’know I was just lying there and I couldn’t wait to just go hang out with my friends, but with you I always y’know with a friend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know you probably don’t want to go out with me, y’know because I make too many jokes and I’ve never been in a serious relationship and I guess I’m not technically a “doctor…”
(Monica runs over and kisses him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There was just one woman, wasn’t there?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, there were two.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Including me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing a new song as the gang looks on.
